meanings.definition: To surgically remove a part of an organ or tissue.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will be resecting the tumor from the patient's lung.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon is resecting the damaged section of the intestine.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked about resecting the burnt edges of the toast.
meanings.sent4: She felt like resecting the negativity from her life.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully resected the dead branches from the tree.

meanings.definition: To cut out or excise a portion of something.
meanings.sent1: The tailor is resecting the torn fabric to repair the shirt.
meanings.sent2: The artist is resecting a piece of paper to create a collage.
meanings.sent3: The student pretended to be resecting the wrong answers from the test paper.
meanings.sent4: He felt like resecting the unnecessary details from his presentation.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor skillfully resected the excess clay to reveal the sculpture.
